messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] shinsa  question
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Milt, You would have to ask the team about the menuki, but the fuchi-kashira should be ok. You cannot submit it as a tsuka, but as fuchi-kashira and then
messages.messageBody:
Hi Milt,

You would have to ask the team about the menuki, but the fuchi-kashira
should be ok. You cannot submit it as a tsuka, but as fuchi-kashira and then
menuki, so two separate papers. As for the period, you should get Edo shoki,
Edo zenki, Edo chuki, Edo koki, Edo maki, Bakumatsu, Meiji and the like.

Gordon

-----Original Message-----
From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com [mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of bungotakadasword
Sent: Wednesday, October 19, 2005 1:24 PM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] shinsa question

with the possible shinsa event in N.Y. 2006, I have a shinsa question
regarding submitting a tsuka .
Question..........
Would the shinsa team provide details as to what school the F/K and the
menuki belong to?
I know attributing school to menuki is a " reach " as they can't take
the ito apart to man-handle the menuki, but in the case of a mumei
fuchi, is it possible for a more detail evaluation besides " edo
jidai " ?
Afterall, I don't need to pay $ to get an origami telling me what i
already know, yes ?

Milt








Yahoo! Groups Links
